bibl.title: An Egyptian Seal of Severus Alexander.
bibl.note: British Museum Reg. No. GR 1960.12-14.1. Fired clay disk, h. 5,6 cm, said to be from Egypt. Facing busts of Sarapis and Isis, flanking a standing figure of Tyche (below, Nike and Neilos) in a circle. Surrounding the circle is an inscription, with the name and titles of Severus Alexander. This must be the seal of the emperor himself which was attached to a bale wrapped in cloth and guarding the property of the ruling government in Egypt.
bibl.seg: RÖMER Cornelia Eva and Donald M. BAILEY, An Egyptian Seal of Severus Alexander.

British Museum Reg. No. GR 1960.12-14.1. Fired clay disk, h. 5,6 cm, said to be from Egypt. Facing busts of Sarapis and Isis, flanking a standing figure of Tyche (below, Nike and Neilos) in a circle. Surrounding the circle is an inscription, with the name and titles of Severus Alexander. This must be the seal of the emperor himself which was attached to a bale wrapped in cloth and guarding the property of the ruling government in Egypt.
